```suggestion
## \date March 2021
## \authors Harshal Shende, Stephan Hageboeck (C++ version)
```

Please insert the date and authors, analogous to the other tutorials like [rf101_basics.py](https://github.com/root-project/root/blob/master/tutorials/roofit/rf101_basics.py#L8) for example.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +8,12 @@## \date March 2021
## \authors Harshal Shende, Stephan Hageboeck (C++ version)

import ROOT

comments.body:
```suggestion
canv.Draw()

canv.SaveAs("rf204a_extendedLikelihood.png")
```

Please add this line at the end of the script to save the produced plot to a `png` file. For the C++ example, this is not necessary because the canvas is kept alive to inspect when you launch the script with `root rf204a_extendedLikelihood.C`.

The python script is usually launched with `python rf204a_extendedLikelihood.py` and everything is cleaned up in the end. So we need to save the plot in the end so people can look at it.

Of course one could alternatively keep the interpreter session alive with `python -i rf204a_extendedLikelihood.py`, but if we add the line with `SaveAs` it is consistent with the other python versions of tutorials (see again [rf101_basics.py](https://github.com/root-project/root/blob/master/tutorials/roofit/rf101_basics.py#L72) for example).
